The alternate release scenario was performed assuming that the quantity of chlorine gas released was 100 pounds over a ten (10) minute period with a stability class of D.  The distance to the toxic endpoint was determined to be 0.1 miles.  The source location resulted in a radius of influence corresponding to the toxic endpoint of 0.0087 mg/l that extends the beyond the property boundaries of the facility.  The residential population within the radius of influence was estimated as 11 after a ground aerial map survey of the area.  The public receptors identified within the radius of influence were determined to be a portion of the Oswego River frequently used by the public for fishing.  There were no identified environmental receptors within the radius of influence. 



3.5 General Accidental Release Prevention Program



Due to the Program 3 status of the WPCP facility, the facility is required under Section 112(r) of the CAA to develop a Prevention Program.



3.6 Five-Year Accident History



The WPCP facility has not experienced any accidental releases of chlorine in the past five years.  

3.7 Emergency Response Program



The current WPCP facility is a part of the Fulton emergency response program and is coordinated with local emergency response agencies, and includes provisions for public notification in the event of a release.
